result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J. Radosevich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**229 days credit if revoked**
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
**Amended 12/04/14 per Court order at probation review hearing- added jail time and condition of Drug Court.

Staying Jail Time
IT IS ORDERED the defendant's remaining jail time is hereby ordered stayed as of January 7, 2015. The jail time will remain stayed pending good standing status in the Treatment Court and will be waived in the event the defendant continues with successful completion of the Eau Claire County Treatment Court Program requirements. The stayed jail time may be re-imposed for good cause.
/s/ January 2, 2015

(proceedings not on the record)
Defendant appears with Attorney Dana Smetana.
State by Gary King, DA.
Pat Isenberger, from DHS, also appears.
Review of treatment court program.

Administrative Transfer to Treatment Court.
IT IS ORDERED that this case is transferred to Branch 2 while defendant is a participant in the Treatment Court program.  The case will be administratively reassigned back to the initial court upon defendant's successful completion or defendant's termination from that program.
/s/ Judge Paul Lenz December 30, 2014
